properties.name: Backspace
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle    115 Nw 5th Ave, Portland, OR, 97209Coffee and arcade fun. Free wireless. Open until 2am. Here is what they say, "Visit & discover a techno-playground; a modern arcade for the modern gamer featuring top of the line networked systems on a fat internet pipe."

properties.name: Clyde Common
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda  1014 SW Stark St, Portland, OR 97205Man the media in this town can\'t help but out-review each other. Blogs, both weeklies, the daily and the monthly magazine all have hyped this place in the span of two weeks. When we went, it was the kind of place that is cool, but makes you feel cooler and more attractive for being there. Our drinks were solid, the bartender was friendly and knowledgeable and our happy hour bites were delicious. We\'re excited to return and try some of the offal coming out of the kitchen.

properties.name: Free GEEK
properties.description: Posted by Anonymous1731 Southeast 10th Avenue, Portland, OR, 97214Refurbished and in need of refurbishing hardware, parts. Volunteer to repair and distribute to folks in need. A keep Portland weird poster child/tech community center.

properties.name: Giant Mexican Indoor Flea Market
properties.description: Posted by Deisnor     I love this place. It really is worth the trek if you are in need of say Guayabera for the kids, wonderful fresh food or supplies to make your child\'s teacher dinner for Teacher Appreciation week. All reasons I\'ve been. Its a bit of arm chair travel being able to be in a good Mexican flea market in Portland.

properties.name: Glowing Greens Blacklight Miniature Golf
properties.description: Posted by Pdxadventureclub 509 Sw Taylor St, Portland, ORUnderground black light miniature golf. Fun to play in the almost dark but the holes are not very inventive. Recommendation: play second 9 and skip the glasses. Airbrush images are wild!

properties.description: Posted by Deisnor534 SE Oak Street, Portland, ORYou never know. Performance, art sale, corsett fashions and lots of support for local emerging artists.

properties.description: Posted by Yahoolocal724 Nw Davis St, Portland, ORMuseum of Contemporary Crafts (503) 223-2654

properties.name: Pirate Town (zoom in satellite view)
properties.description: Posted by Jason  Under the nopo trainbridge, lies this sinking abandoned, turn of the century wooden barge. I actually don\'t know one bit of history on it, but it\'s obviously either been ship wrecked here, of was the first of a one ship boat graveyard. It is a thrilling place to risk tetnus, scurvy and radiation poisoning, all in one sitting.

properties.name: Portland Farmer's Market
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda   SW Park Ave & SW Montgomery St, Portland, OR 97201The central city farmer\'s market - runs 8:30am - 2pm Saturdays, April through December. Great local farmers and producers of everything from chocolates to cheeses, pates, and wines. Not a bad place for a morning snack, either - wood-oven asparagus pizzas, anyone?

properties.name: SCRAP
properties.description: Posted by Deisnor     901 N Williams Ave Portland, ORReuse outpost, social hub and shop. Open workshops every day they\'\'re open. Crafting booths at most interesting public events.

properties.name: The Tao of Tea
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel 3430 Southeast Belmont Street, Portland, OR, 97214Staff Picks: Best Place to Get Out of the Rain "A quiet, meditative and relaxing place to spend an afternoon trying a huge selection of gourmet teas in a Japanese garden-ish atmosphere. Take a good book. Nice menu with an amazing smoked vanilla ice cream." - Drew

properties.name: Tryon Creek State Park, Main Entrance
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05 A beautiful park with tons of trails. From the main parking lot I really enjoy taking the dogs on the North Horse Loop. There are generally fewer hikers here so it is easier to let the dogs loose. The nature center has maps of all the trails in the park, and there are many!

properties.name: Vita Cafe

properties.name: Voodoo Doughnuts
properties.description: Posted by Jason     22 SW 3rd Ave, portland, orCocoa Puff doughnuts, voodoo doll doughnuts, cock&balls doughnuts. Only open in the middle of hte night, 10pm - 10am. Mostly organic locally grown ingredients too! OOh, they have eating contests, bands play there etc. http://www.voodoodoughnut.com/

properties.name: Witches' Castle - Stone House
properties.description: Posted by Jason     Somewhat old stone house ruins. It is unclear exactly what it had been, but rumors of rituals have always surrounded this magnificently mossy specimen.

properties.name: more everyday sunshine
properties.description: Posted by TooldivaThis is as good a place as any to start discovering one of Portland\'s most conceptual public art projects. Along the entire length of the streetcar line, there are fourteen motion-sensored spotlights that are triggered by pedestrians walking along the sidewalk. You must be on the same side of the street and walking in the same direction as the streetcar runs. The spotlights are attached to utility poles. The light won\'t come on immediately - sometimes it takes several minutes for it to fade on and slowly fade off. The spotlights illuminate things you might not normally think too much about, like a simple architectural feature, a park bench, or a patch of dirt. When I first heard Harrell Fletcher describe his concept for the project, it went something like this: "When I was a boy, my father and I would go on walks and he would point at things that he thought were interesting. Later in my life, I studied photography, and I thought of that as a form of pointing, or saying "I find this interesting." The spotlights are intended to illuminate things that I found interesting along the streetcar line." This public art piece makes a really fun evening walk for the curious.
